document.heading: CFO Membership on the Health and Hospitals Public Benefit Corporation Board, Council Review of Board Promulgations, and Approval of Organizational and Operational Plan Amendment Act of 1997

history.narrative: Law 12-43, the “CFO Membership on the Health and Hospitals Public Benefit Corporation Board, Council Review of Board Promulgations, and Approval of Organizational and Operational Plan Amendment Act of 1997,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-109, which was referred to the Committee on Economic Development. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 3, 1997, and June 17, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 17, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-127 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-43 became effective on October 8, 1997.

Code § 3-262.7(a is amended by adding a new paragraph (3A) to read as follows 3A) The Board shall submit the policies, practices, procedures, and regulations that it promulgates and issues pursuant to paragraphs (2) and (3) of this subsection, consistent with the District of Columbia Financial Plan and Budget, to the Council by September 16, 1997, for a 45-day period of review excluding Saturdays, Sundays, legal holidays, and days of Council recess. If the Council does not approve or disapprove the policies, practices, procedures, or regulations, in whole or in part, by resolution within the 45-day review period, the policies, practices, procedures, or regulations shall be deemed approved Sec. 3. Sec. 4. Enactment of this legislation will have no negative fiscal impact. Members of the PBC Board receive no compensation. Council approval of the Organizational and Operational Plan is contingent upon the Chief Financial Officer’s certifying that the Plan is consistent with the District’s Financial Plan and Budget. In addition, the PBC’s procurement and personnel regulations are required to be consistent with the District’s Financial Plan Budget. Sec. 5.
